title: Power Finance Corp to raise Rs 5,000 crore via public issue of bonds
author: Manish M. Suvarna
content:
Power Finance Corporation (PFC) is planning to raise Rs 5,000 crore through public issue of bonds, company said in a release.The bonds have a base size of Rs 500 crore, with a greenshoe option of Rs 4,500 crore. The aggregate amount of Rs 5,000 crore is within the shelf limit of Rs 10,000 crore.The issue will open for subscription on January 16, 2026, and will close on January 30, 2026, with an option of early closure or extension, release said.

The company is offering the coupon rate between 6.85-7.30 percent across series, company said in a release.The bonds have been rated 'AAA' with 'Stable' outlook by CARE, CRISIL and ICRA, and is proposed to be listed on the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE).The company will utilise 75 percent of the proceeds from bonds for the purpose of onward lending, financing/ refinancing the existing indebtedness, and remaining 25 percent for the general corporate purposes, company added.

This public issue of bonds comes at a time when the company has seen a withdrawal of three bond issues of private placement in the primary corporate bond market amid higher coupon demanded by the investors.

On December 23, Moneycontrol have reported that third time in a row, Power Finance Corporation (PFC) on December 23 have withdrawn their bond issuances after the investors demand higher yields on their bonds following a surge yields on government securities.

Prior to this issue, PFC withdrew two bond issuances on December 9 of worth Rs 3,500 crore, maturing in 15 years, and November 26 of Rs 3,000 crore maturing in 3-year-4-month-17-day.On December 9, Moneycontrol reported that PFC scrapped plans to issue bonds after investors demanded higher coupon rate, following an uptick in the government bond yields.Further, on November 26, Moneycontrol reported that PFC have scrapped plans to issue bonds after investors demanded higher coupon rate, expecting a rate cut by the RBI in December.
